results.firPara: • Ibrox chairman Dave King accuses Ashley of ill-timed departure from board
results.secPara: Dave King, the Rangers chairman, has taken a swipe at Mike Ashley by insisting the Sports Direct tycoon cut and ran from the board of a club retail company when the going got tough.
results.webTitle: Rangers’ Dave King attacks Mike Ashley for quitting club’s retail firm

results.firPara: • Manager says Liverpool wont start dreaming after warm-up win
results.secPara: • Manager says Liverpool wont start dreaming after warm-up win
results.webTitle: Liverpool are ready says Jürgen Klopp after routing Barcelona in friendly

results.firPara: José Mourinho won the first trophy of the new season in his first competitive game as Manchester United manager and immediately dedicated it to his predecessor. Without Louis van Gaal, he pointed out, United would not have been involved in the Community Shield at Wembley.
results.secPara: I would like to dedicate this victory to Louis van Gaal, he said. I dont mind him having one more trophy, and I remember when I have left clubs who have gone on to win things they dont always recognise who helped them get there. So this win is for him and in addition I dedicate it to the Manchester United players who were not involved in the game. It was difficult to leave out good players like Memphis Depay, Phil Jones and Ashley Young, but I had to make choices. We are a team and they understand that.
results.webTitle: José Mourinho dedicates Manchester United Shield win to Louis van Gaal

results.firPara: Manchester United need a quick, energetic forward to capitalise on the work done in deeper areas by Wayne Rooney and Zlatan Ibrahimovic
results.secPara: Zlatan Ibrahimovic usually makes a grand entrance, and it felt somewhat inevitable Manchester Uniteds new centre-forward would prove the matchwinner at Wembley. Overall, Ibrahimovics performance was relatively quiet, but he provided precisely what United were lacking throughout last season – killer instinct in the penalty box.
results.webTitle: Rooney-Ibrahimovic axis needs to be complemented by a dynamic runner | Michael Cox

results.firPara: Stand up, for the champions, the Leicester City supporters chorused at kick-off, anxious not to miss a trick. If there are a million things Foxes fans have found themselves thinking and doing over the summer that would not have been dreamed of 12 months ago, this was the 1,000,001st go to Wembley and taunt Manchester United with a chant that for many years used to reverberate around Old Trafford.
results.secPara: For about half an hour Leicester played like champions, too. That is to say, they gave a good impression of their stubborn selves from last season. They did not fall apart in defence through the lack of NGolo Kanté, Riyad Mahrez was still able to make Luke Shaw look leaden-footed with some delightful flashes of inspiration on the right wing and, although United quite sensibly restricted the space available for Jamie Vardy to run into, the striker nevertheless managed to embarrass Eric Bailly on a couple of occasions.
results.webTitle: Jesse Lingard gets José Mourinho’s Manchester United up and running

results.firPara: Christian Bentekes agent has confirmed Liverpool have yet to receive any new offers for the Belgium striker but is hopeful of resolving his future before the end of the transfer window.
results.secPara: Benteke, who signed from Aston Villa last summer for £32.5m, has yet to feature for Liverpool in pre-season having fallen behind Daniel Sturridge, Danny Ings, Divock Origi, Sadio Mané and Roberto Firmino in the pecking order at Anfield. Last week the manager, Jürgen Klopp, said he will not allow the 25-year-old to be a present for potential suitors, with Crystal Palace having seen a £25m bid rejected last month.
results.webTitle: Liverpool yet to receive improved bids for striker Christian Benteke

results.firPara: New division, same old feeling for Aston Villa. This had been heading towards an encouraging draw for Roberto Di Matteos new side in South Yorkshire, in their first game out of the English top flight since 1988, yet Fernando Forestieri curtailed the hope and optimism surrounding their new dawn that had filled the air before kick-off.
results.secPara: The Italians late goal following a dreadful clearance from the debutant Villa goalkeeper, Pierluigi Gollini, secured Sheffield Wednesday an opening victory and a continuation of their buoyant run at the end of last season, when they came within touching distance of the Premier League.
results.webTitle: Aston Villa goalkeeper’s error hands points to Sheffield Wednesday

results.firPara: Zlatan Ibrahimovic scored the winner as Manchester United kicked off the season by beating Leicester City 2-1 to win the Community Shield
results.secPara: Read David Hytners match report from Wembley right here
results.webTitle: Leicester City 1-2 Manchester United: Community Shield – as it happened

results.firPara: A very impressive performance from Jimmy Floyd Hasselbainks QPR saw them beat a largely anonymous Leeds 3-0 at Loftus Road.
results.secPara: A very impressive performance from Jimmy Floyd Hasselbainks QPR saw them beat a largely anonymous Leeds 3-0 at Loftus Road.
results.webTitle: Queens Park Rangers 3-0 Leeds United: Championship – as it happened
